Classes¶

Client¶

class grokpy.client.Client(key=None, baseURL=None, connection=None)¶

A client to access the Grok HTTP API.

  • [key] - Grok API Key
  • [baseURL] - Grok server request target
  • [connection] - An instance of the grokpy.Connection class. Used mainly for testing.
static alignPredictions(headers, resultRows)¶

Returns a list of list suitable for writing to a CSV file. Puts predictions on the same row the actual value for easy comparison in external tools like Excel.

  • headers - A list of strings to use as column headers.
  • resultRows - A list of lists representing the output data from a model.

Example Transformation:

RowID   ActualValue     PredictedValue
0       3               5
1       5               7
2       7               9

RowID   ActualValue     PredictedValue
0       3
1       5               5
2       7               7
                        9
createModel(spec, streamId, parent=None, url=None)¶

Returns a Model object.

  • spec - A configuration for this model. Can be EITHER a file path to a JSON document OR a Python dict
  • streamId - The Id of the stream to which this model should listen.
  • [parent] - A Project object which associates this model with a specific parent project.
  • [url] - The target for creating this model. Automatically specified when calling project.createModel() rather than client.createModel().
createProject(projectName)¶

Returns a Project object.

  • projectName - Used primarly for display purposes
createStream(spec, name=None, parent=None, url=None)¶

Returns an instance of the Stream object.

  • spec - Can be EITHER a file path to a JSON document OR a Python dict
  • [name] - A name for the stream, used mainly for display.
  • [parent] - A Project object which associates this stream with a specific parent project.
  • [url] - The target for creating this stream. Automatically specified when calling project.createStream() rather than client.createStream()
deleteAllModels(verbose=False)¶

Permanently deletes all models associated with the current API key.

  • [verbose] - If set, the model Id of each model being deleted will be printed.

Warning

There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

deleteAllProjects(verbose=False)¶

Permanently deletes all projects

  • [verbose] - If set, the model Id of each model being deleted will be printed.

Warning

There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

deleteAllStreams(url=None, verbose=False)¶

Permanently deletes all streams associated with the current API key.

  • [verbose] - If set, the stream Id of each stream being deleted will be printed.

Warning

There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

getModel(modelId, url=None)¶

Returns a Model object corresponding to the given modelId

  • modelId
  • [url] - Usually only specified when calling the equivalent method on a project.
getProject(projectId)¶

Returns a Project with the given Id

  • projectId
getPublicDataSource(id)¶

Looks up and returns a PDS by its code.

getStream(streamId, url=None)¶

Returns a Stream object corresponding to the given streamId

  • streamId
  • [url] - Usually only specified when calling the equivalent method on a project.
getUser(userId=None)¶

Returns a User object. By default returns the first user associated with this API key.

  • [userId]
listModels(url=None)¶

Returns a list of Models. By default it will return a list of all models tied to the current API key.

TODO: Update this once the list returned from the server contains info about what projects the models belong to.

  • [url] - Usually only specified when calling the equivalent method on a project.
listProjects()¶

Lists all the projects currently associated with this account

listPublicDataSources()¶

Lists all the public data sources registered with Grok

listStreams(url=None)¶

Returns a list of Stream objects. By default it will return a list of all streams tied to the current API key.

  • [url] - Usually only specified when calling the equivalent method on a project.

Connection¶

class grokpy.connection.Connection(key=None, baseURL='http://api.grok.numenta.com/', session=None)¶

Connection object for the Grok Prediction Service

request(method, url, requestDef=None, params=None)¶

Interface for all HTTP requests made to the Grok API

Exceptions¶

Base exceptions for the Grok Client Library

Field¶

class grokpy.field.Field(**kwargs)¶

A complex object specification which allows Grok to properly interpret input data.

Model¶

class grokpy.model.Model(parent, modelDef)¶

Object representing a Grok Model.

  • parent - Either a Client or Project.
  • modelDef - A dict, usually returned from a model creation or get action. Usually includes:
    • id
    • name
    • streamId
    • swarmsUrl
    • url
delete()¶

Permanently deletes the model

Warning

There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

disableLearning(retries=3)¶

Puts the model into a predictions only state where it will not learn from new data.

Retries - If this method is called immediately after model promotion it may
fail. By default we will retry a few times.
enableLearning()¶

New records will be integrated into the models future predictions.

getDescription()¶

Get the current state of the model from Grok

getModelOutput()¶

Returns the data in the output cache of the best model found during Swarm.

getMultiStepPredictions(buffer, timesteps)¶

Warning

Experimental.

Gets predictions for the next N timesteps

  • buffer - A set of actual values to send in to prime predictions. This buffer

    should be sent in with each call and updated as new actual values are measured.

  • timesteps - The number of steps into the future to predict.

Example:

--TIMESTEP 1 --
buffer = [[0],
          [1],
          [2],
          [0],
          [1],
          [2]]

Call:
  model.getMultiStepPredictions(buffer, 3)
Return:
  3 rows of predictions, which when converted back to input format look
  like

  results = [[.01],
             [1.01],
             [2.01]]

--TIMESTEP 2 --
buffer = [[0],
          [1],
          [2],
          [0],
          [1],
          [2],
          [0]] # Note the extra actual value we have now

Call:
  model.getMultiStepPredictions(buffer, 3)
Return:
  3 rows of predictions, which when converted back to input format
  look like

  results = [[1.01],
             [2.01],
             [.01]] # Predictions are now one more timestep in the future
getSwarmState()¶

Returns the current state of a swarm.

TODO: Check this works when you get a model that’s already created and swarming

monitorPredictions(endRow=False)¶

Continually polls for new predictions until endRow is hit.

TODO: Move from polling to async streaming when API server supports

setLocationField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setLocationFieldIndex()

setName(newName)¶

Rename the model

setNote(newNote)¶

Adds or updates a note for this model

setPredictionField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setPredictionFieldIndex()

setPredictionFieldIndex(index)¶

The stream field for which we are optimizing predictions.

setStream(stream)¶

Associates a stream with a model

setTemporalField(fieldName)¶

Wrapper for setTemporalFieldIndex()

setTemporalFieldIndex(index)¶

Which stream field provides temporal data for the model

setTimeAggregation(aggregationType)¶

How the model will aggregate data within the stream

Valid Types:

RECORD: no aggregation is done. SECONDS MINUTES 15_MINUTES HOURS DAYS WEEKS MONTHS

start()¶

Starts up a model, readying it to receive new data from a stream

startSwarm()¶

Runs permutations on model parameters to find the optimal model characteristics for the given data.

stop()¶

Stops a model. Stopped models will not listen for new data or produce predictions

stopSwarm()¶

Terminates a Swarm in progress

Project¶

class grokpy.project.Project(parentClient, projectDef)¶

Object representing a Grok project

createModel(spec, streamId)¶

Return a new Model object. The model will be created under this project.

createStream(spec, name=None)¶

Returns a new Stream object. The stream will be created under this project.

delete()¶

Permanently deletes the project, all its models, and data.

WARNING: There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

deleteAllStreams(verbose=False)¶

Permanently deletes all streams associated with the current project

WARNING: There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

getDescription()¶

Returns the current state of the project from Grok

getModel(modelId)¶

Returns the model corresponding to the given modelId

getStream(streamId)¶

Returns a Stream object from the given streamId. Assumes the stream is part of this project.

listModels()¶

Returns a list of Models that exist in this project

listStreams()¶

Returns a list of streams associated with the current project

setName(newName)¶

Rename the project

stopAllModels(verbose=False)¶

Stops all running models in this project.

Public Data Source¶

class grokpy.publicDataSource.PublicDataSource(connection, description)¶

Object describing a public data source

Currently this lives only in the client. The intent is to have a server side object representing a PDS as well.

listFields()¶

Returns a list of the names of fields currently in the PDS

setConfiguration(value=None, locationFieldName=None)¶

Populates the ‘configuration’ field within the provider. What this configuration should be varies from provider to provider.

See the API Reference under providerDefinitionList

useField(fieldName)¶

Sets a field to be added to the data stream by this publicDataSource for every record passed into Grok

Stream¶

class grokpy.stream.Stream(parent, streamDef)¶

A Stream is the combination of data and the specification of those data that will be used by a model

addField(**kwargs)¶

Add a field object to a stream

addRecords(records, step=5000)¶

Appends records to the input cache of the given stream.

configure(filePath)¶

Reads JSON from a given file and uses that to configure the stream

delete()¶

Permanently deletes this stream.

WARNING: There is currently no way to recover from this opperation.

usePublicDataSource(publicDataSource)¶

Takes a configured publicDataSource and attaches it to the stream

Stream Monitor¶

class grokpy.streaming.StreamMonitor¶
on_error(status_code)¶

Called when a non-200 status code is returned

on_state(state)¶

Called when a new state is received from connection.

Override this method if you wish to manually handle the stream data. Return False to stop stream and close connection.

on_timeout()¶

Called when stream connection times out
